      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(String hqlQuery,
                String[][] keysAndValues)
                  throws TransactionException
        Returns the number of updated rows.

        The hql-query may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        hqlQuery - the update query
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjectsWhere

        public <T> List<T> loadObjectsWhere(String where,
                           String[][] keysAndValues,
                           Class<T> cl)
                         throws TransactionException
        Returns a list of objects of the given class from the database which satisfy the where-clause.

        The where-clause may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        where - the where-clause for the database
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        cl - the class to load
        Returns:
        List<?>
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • iterateObjectsWhere

        public HibernateIterator iterateObjectsWhere(String where,
                                    String[][] keysAndValues,
                                    Class<?> cl)
                                      throws TransactionException
        Returns a HibernateIterator containing objects of the given class specified by the given where-clause.

        The where-clause may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        where - where-clause
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        cl - the class to load
        Returns:
        HibernateIterator
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjects

        public List<?> loadObjects(String hqlSelect,
                  String[][] keysAndValues)
                    throws TransactionException
        Returns a list of objects from the database which satisfy the hql-statement.

        The hql-statement may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        hqlSelect - the hql-select-statement
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        Returns:
        List<?>
        Throws:
        TransactionException

        Returns an object from the database which satisfy the hql-statement.

        The hql-statement may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.

      • loadFirstObjectWhere

        public <T> T loadFirstObjectWhere(String where,
                         Class<T> cl)
                       throws TransactionException
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadFirstObjectWhere

        public <T> T loadFirstObjectWhere(String where,
                         String[][] keysAndValues,
                         Class<T> cl)
                       throws TransactionException
        Returns an object of the given class from the database which satisfy the where-clause.

        The where-clause may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        where - the where-clause for the database
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        cl - the class to load
        Returns:
        the single result or null
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if there is more than one result

      • deleteWhere

        public void deleteWhere(String where,
               String[][] keysAndValues,
               Class<?> cl)
                 throws TransactionException
        Deletes objects from the given class specified by the where-clause from the database.

        The where-clause may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        where - where-clause
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        cl - the class to load
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadIterableObjects

        public Iterator<?> loadIterableObjects(String hqlSelect,
                              String[][] keysAndValues)
                                throws TransactionException
        Returns a Iterator containing objects specified by the given hql-statement.

        The hql-statement may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        hqlSelect - hql-statement
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        Returns:
        Iterator
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjectsWhithinLimits

        public List<?> loadObjectsWhithinLimits(String where,
                               Class<?> cl,
                               int offset,
                               int rpp)
                                 throws TransactionException
        Liest eine Tabelle aus - liefert aber nur rpp (results per page) Eintr�ge ab dem offset zur�ck - sollte signifikant geringerer Speicherbedarf sein, weil nicht ganze Liste gelesen werden muss.
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjectsWhithinLimits

        public List<?> loadObjectsWhithinLimits(String hqlselect,
                               int offset,
                               int rpp)
                                 throws TransactionException
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjectsWhithinLimits

        public List<?> loadObjectsWhithinLimits(String where,
                               String[][] keysAndValues,
                               Class<?> cl,
                               int offset,
                               int rpp)
                                 throws TransactionException
        Returns a list of objects of the given class from the database which satisfy the where-clause and are within the defined range.

        The where-clause may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        where - the where-clause
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        cl - the class to load
        offset - first result
        rpp - max results
        Returns:
        List<?>
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • loadObjectsWhithinLimits

        public List<?> loadObjectsWhithinLimits(String hqlselect,
                               String[][] keysAndValues,
                               int offset,
                               int rpp)
                                 throws TransactionException
        Returns a list of objects from the database which specified by the hql-statement and are within the defined range.

        The hql-statement may contain an arbitrary number of keys in the format :keyname
        The keys and their associated values need to be mapped in the array keysAndValues.
        Note that the keys in the array must start without the colon.
        Parameters:
        hqlselect - the hql-statement
        keysAndValues - an array of keynames with their associated values
        offset - first result
        rpp - max results
        Returns:
        List<?>
        Throws:
        TransactionException

      • getDBTime

        public long getDBTime()
               throws TransactionException
        Etwas kompliziert: Es ist nicht n�tig, st�ndig die DB anzufragen, wieviel Uhr es ist. Vielmehr holen wir einmal alle 100 Minuten einen Korrekturwert zur lokalen Uhr. Damit haben wir eine ausreichende Genauigkeit und errechnen die DB-Uhrzeit aus der lokalen Systemzeit.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        TransactionException
